result.execSummary:
The defendant Shelli L Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders restitution to be paid in full by FEBRUARY 1, 2016. If not paid, court reduces amount to civil judgment.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
with Huber and Good Time Credit

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shelli L Clark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:32 pm case called. Defendant Shelli L Clark in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Seifert. Court sentences the defendant to: 25 days WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit. No Credit for time served. To begin no later than January 4, 2016. Restitution in the amount of $103.53 to be paid no later than February 1, 2015 if not paid court reduces to a civil judgment. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA surcharge to be assessed. No sample to be given. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing at 12-08-2015 02:00 pm

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Katherine Seifert in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Seifert.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing at 11-03-2015 09:30 am
from Atty Seifert requesting adjournment - Granted by the court
Sentencing hearing at 10-05-2015 02:15 pm

Case called @ 2:45 p.m. Defendant Shelli L Clark in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have reached a resolution.  The court will adjourn for a plea hearing. The court will not remove the trial date from the calendar until a plea has been entered. Recess for Atty Seifert to discuss possibility of entering a plea today.  

Case recalled @ 3:26 p.m. Defendant will be entering a plea and is requesting 60 days for sentencing. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. The court reminds the defendant that bond remains in effect and the offer may be revoked if there would be a violation of the bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
